{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3193484,"name":"","username":"Kully","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kully/{size}/264955_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-19T10:20:21.554Z","cooked":"

Hey all,

We‚Äôre looking into getting new hardware to do AprilTags better this year, since our hardware this year was too slow to be used reliably (we got 8-10FPS with a LL2+ which because of the camera being rolling shutter, makes everything a blurry mess when you‚Äôre moving at high speeds (with photon))

I‚Äôd love to hear experiences and what setups worked for you, and recommendations for it.

First thing on my list is to try and get a global shutter camera to avoid the smearing/blurr from fast motion with low FPS.
Currently looking at maybe a Orange PI 4/5 and getting 2 global shutter cameras so we can have backward and forward coverage, would love to hear more thoughts though. since maybe just using a global shutter camera externally with a LL2+ might have better results? (We have a LL2+ & LL2)

would love some help and insight!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2023-04-19T10:20:21.554Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":351,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":1795.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":435027,"topic_slug":"recommended-good-apriltag-hardware-setups","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54481,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor of ftc 12016 üñ§ü§é"},"post_url":"/t/recommended-good-apriltag-hardware-setups/435027/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor of ftc 12016 üñ§ü§é","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3193492,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-19T11:13:20.035Z","cooked":"

Linking this post:

FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2023 Build Thread Open Alliance
Software Update #2: Finding the North Star Let‚Äôs talk about AprilTags. We gained a lot of valuable experience last year with full field localization using reflective tape (more info here), and we‚Äôre very excited about the opportunities that AprilTags provide with superior precision, robustness, and ease of use. I also want to note before getting into the details that the code for this project is not designed to be ‚Äúplug and play‚Äù in the same way as many of our recent projects. See the importan‚Ä¶

This is the route my team plans to go. @jonahb55 and the rest of 6328 have several awesome posts about their vision system. They are the reigning ‚Äòauto champions‚Äô in New England partly because of the accuracy of their vision system. They used specifically the Orange Pi 5 with a camera they linked and achieved around 45-50 fps at 1600x1200.

Thats the route my team will be going this year. I‚Äôm trying to avoid spending the money on limelights as it looks like with time you can beat the performance. 6328s concept is to have multiple cameras constantly pose estimating your robot. This past year we used PhotonVision which seems a good bit less performance then leveraging OPenCVs ArUco module. But I know they were thinking of adopting that style as well.

(Edit - so sorry I can‚Äôt directly recommend this approach since we haven‚Äôt used it‚Ä¶ YET ‚Ä¶ but I wanted to get your eyes on this one, you might find it useful)
